sourcesContent:
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react"; import { useParams } from "react-router-dom"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; import axios from "axios"; import "./style.css"; const HouseDetails = () => { const { index } = useParams(); // We will use this as the house ID const [house, setHouse] = useState(null); // State to hold the house details const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); // State to handle loading const [error, setError] = useState(null); // State to handle errors const [mainImage, setMainImage] = useState(""); // State for the main image // Fetch house details from the backend useEffect(() => { const houseId = match.params.id; // Extract house ID from route params fetch(`/api/houseDetails/${houseId}`) .then((response) => response.json()) .then((data) => setHouseDetails(data)) .catch((error) => console.error("Error fetching house details:", error)); }, [match.params.id]); return (
{/* Left Column - Main Image */}
{/* Main Image */} {/* Thumbnail Images */}
{house.images && house.images.exterior.map((image, index) => ( setMainImage(image)} // Set clicked image as the main image /> ))}
{/* Buttons */}
{/* Right Column - House Details */}

{house.name}

Description:

{house.desp}

Price:

₹ {house.price} lakhs

Area Required:

{house.area} sq ft

Material Required:

{house.material}

Land Options:

{house.landOptions}

Contractor/Architect:

{house.contractor.name}

{house.contractor.contact}

); }; export default HouseDetails;
